meanings.definition: A place where coal is mined.
meanings.sent1: The miners worked hard in the coalpits to extract coal.
meanings.sent2: The coal company owned several coalpits in the valley.
meanings.sent3: Why did the canary refuse to sing in the coalpits? It was afraid of hitting a high note!
meanings.sent4: The coalpits were like hungry giants, devouring the earth's black treasures.
meanings.sent5: The coalpits echoed with the sounds of picks striking against rock.

meanings.definition: A pit or excavation in the earth from which coal is taken.
meanings.sent1: The coalpits were deep and dark, filled with the promise of fuel.
meanings.sent2: Miners descended into the coalpits early each morning to start their work.
meanings.sent3: Why did the ghost refuse to haunt the coalpits? It found them too 'unearthly'!
meanings.sent4: The coalpits yawned open like hungry mouths waiting to be fed.
meanings.sent5: The coalpits seemed to breathe in the damp, musty air of the underground.
